The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
Edmund Burke
The ultimate tragedy is not the oppression and cruelty by the bad people but the silence over that by the good people.
Martin Luther King, Jr.
Less is only more where more is no good.
Frank Lloyd Wright
Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
John D. Rockefeller
Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.
Will Rogers
Goodness is about character - integrity, honesty, kindness, generosity, moral courage, and the like. More than anything else, it is about how we treat other people.
Dennis Prager

But I say to you, Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you, so that you may be sons of your Father who is in heaven; for he makes his sun rise on the evil and on the good, and sends rain on the just and on the unjust.
Jesus Christ
Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
Voltaire
The true measure of a man is how he treats someone who can do him absolutely no good.
Samuel Johnson
Doing well is the result of doing good. That's what capitalism is all about.
Ralph Waldo Emerson
A good character is the best tombstone. Those who loved you and were helped by you will remember you when forget-me-nots have withered. Carve your name on hearts, not on marble.
Charles Spurgeon
Good people do not need laws to tell them to act responsibly, while bad people will find a way around the laws.
Plato
There is nothing either good or bad but thinking makes it so.
William Shakespeare
I have made good judgments in the past. I have made good judgments in the future.
Dan Quayle
If you don't think every day is a good day, just try missing one.
Cavett Robert
Be not simply good - be good for something.
Henry David Thoreau
The fragrance of flowers spreads only in the direction of the wind. But the goodness of a person spreads in all directions.
Chanakya
The roots of all goodness lie in the soil of appreciation for goodness.
Dalai Lama

I'm convinced of this: Good done anywhere is good done everywhere. For a change, start by speaking to people rather than walking by them like they're stones that don't matter. As long as you're breathing, it's never too late to do some good.
Maya Angelou
When I'm good, I'm very good. But when I'm bad I'm better.
Mae West
A true friend is someone who thinks that you are a good egg even though he knows that you are slightly cracked.
Bernard Meltzer
Associate yourself with people of good quality, for it is better to be alone than in bad company.
Booker T. Washington
If you can't make it good, at least make it look good.
Bill Gates
Despite everything, I believe that people are really good at heart.
Anne Frank
The good old days are now.
Tom Clancy
There are three ingredients in the good life: learning, earning and yearning.
Christopher Morley
The more we come out and do good to others, the more our hearts will be purified, and God will be in them.
Swami Vivekananda
Honest disagreement is often a good sign of progress.
Mahatma Gandhi
The good and the wise lead quiet lives.
Euripides
All good things which exist are the fruits of originality.
John Stuart Mill
Learn to... be what you are, and learn to resign with a good grace all that you are not.
Henri Frederic Amiel
No one can be good for long if goodness is not in demand.
Bertolt Brecht
The word 'good' has many meanings. For example, if a man were to shoot his grandmother at a range of five hundred yards, I should call him a good shot, but not necessarily a good man.
Gilbert K. Chesterton
A good beginning makes a good end.
Louis L'Amour
What the people want is very simple - they want an America as good as its promise.
Barbara Jordan
Life comes from physical survival; but the good life comes from what we care about.
Rollo May
It's good to shut up sometimes.
Marcel Marceau
Good things do not come easy. The road is lined with pitfalls.
Desi Arnaz
The crest and crowning of all good, Life's final star, is brotherhood.
Edwin Markham
It takes a great man to be a good listener.
Calvin Coolidge

To be a good citizen, it's important to be able to put yourself in other people's shoes and see the big picture. If everything you see is rooted in your own identity, that becomes difficult or impossible.
Eli Pariser
I'd rather be lucky than good.
Lefty Gomez
Good leaders make people feel that they're at the very heart of things, not at the periphery.
Warren Bennis
In every age 'the good old days' were a myth. No one ever thought they were good at the time. For every age has consisted of crises that seemed intolerable to the people who lived through them.
Brooks Atkinson
Good thoughts bear good fruit, bad thoughts bear bad fruit.
James Allen
Good advice is something a man gives when he is too old to set a bad example.
Francois de La Rochefoucauld
It takes many good deeds to build a good reputation, and only one bad one to lose it.
Benjamin Franklin
A man is called selfish not for pursuing his own good, but for neglecting his neighbor's.
Richard Whately
We cannot make good news out of bad practice.
Edward R. Murrow
A good listener is not only popular everywhere, but after a while, he knows something.
Wilson Mizner
On the whole, human beings want to be good, but not too good, and not quite all the time.
George Orwell
Have a very good reason for everything you do.
Laurence Olivier
I know that every good and excellent thing in the world stands moment by moment on the razor-edge of danger and must be fought for.
Thornton Wilder
There has to be evil so that good can prove its purity above it.
Unknown

Treat those who are good with goodness, and also treat those who are not good with goodness. Thus goodness is attained. Be honest to those who are honest, and be also honest to those who are not honest. Thus honesty is attained.
Lao Tzu
Goodness is the only investment that never fails.
Henry David Thoreau
That which is striking and beautiful is not always good, but that which is good is always beautiful.
Ninon de L'Enclos
If people are good only because they fear punishment, and hope for reward, then we are a sorry lot indeed.
Albert Einstein
Be sweet, be good, and honest always.
Emma Bunton
An inexhaustible good nature is one of the most precious gifts of heaven, spreading itself like oil over the troubled sea of thought, and keeping the mind smooth and equable in the roughest weather.
Washington Irving
